item.title: 3-4 metres of damage to the highway which is now causing drop kerb to move., 23rd May
item.description:
The Grange, Old Tiad, Southam, Cheltenham GL52 3NN. There have been a couple of burst water mains at the top of New Road and a manhole cover being forced up of the B4632 Cleeve Hill road twice in severe wet weather over the winter months. Highways have put up signage on the B4632 twice and we’re aware of the volume of water cascading down the road, onto New Road, across to Old Road and then into a drain further down Old Road. This has caused damage outside Tge Grange residential property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Big depression, northbound Lane, opposite Hill Court Road, 23rd May
item.description:
An old utility trench has sunk and is now causing significant noise and vibration, disturbing local residents. Trench existed before cycleway works begun, but is now in the vehicle wheel tracks and has clearly collapsed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Evesham Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass verg has not been cut sufficiently to allow safe exit from junction, 23rd May
item.description:
The small section of grass which has been cut you still could not see a car coming at 50mph.. also if it was clear in this section and you pull out its still dangerous Cut the grass properly and safely!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
